required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: haMSter: a Novel Smartphone Communication Tool for People With MS
clinical_study.official_title: haMSter: a Novel Smartphone Communication Tool for People With MS

brief_summary.textblock:
haMSter is a smartphone app that tracks validated patient reported outcome measures (PROMs) in people multiple sclerosis (MS). In this study, 50 patients with MS will receive this app for 6 months and be asked to fill out the PRO questionnaires on their Smartphone.
Endpoints include the adherence to this app and satisfaction with this Intervention.

primary_outcome.time_frame: over the course of this study (over 6 months)
primary_outcome.description: Percentage (Number) of participants having completed all necessary questionnaires per study period. Max: 6 completions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall satisfaction with this application in telemedicine
secondary_outcome.description: TMPQ (Telemedicine Perception Questionnaire). Min: 0 points. Max: 80 Points. Higher scores indicate a better outcome

secondary_outcome.measure: General satisfaction with specific Features of the haMSter app
secondary_outcome.description: Empirical questionnaires. We will Report frequencies of answers given. There is no Overall score in a larger sense.

arm_group.description: Patients receiving the app for personal use for 6 months

intervention.description: the app tracks patient reported outcomes

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Any MS according to MacDonald criteria
- informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- language barriers

patient_data.ipd_description: Individual participant data can only be shared after publication and upon reasonable request made to our local ethics review board.
